conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m formally applying because your academic environment and expectations align best with how I learn and the goals I’m working toward. If offered a seat, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying now is my best chance to secure my first-choice seat before higher-priority students potentially take it. I will express strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for placing School_A as your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round, we are not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is applying and ranks School_A first, so accepting would secure a committed match. However, on School_A’s true priority list, Student_A is 3rd behind Student_B and Student_D. Given full information, Student_B prefers School_B first and Student_D prefers School_C first, so they are unlikely to apply to School_A in round 1; but they could later if rejected elsewhere. With only one seat, accepting Student_A now would forgo any chance to match with higher-priority Student_B or Student_D if they become available later. Since the process allows continued negotiations and we are not required to fill immediately, the best move to maximize priority is to reject Student_A now and keep the seat open for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: School_C Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying because School_C is my first-choice school. I’m especially drawn to the academic environment and I’m ready to contribute actively to the school community. If admitted, I will commit fully and make School_C my top priority. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before competition intensifies (Student_E also ranks School_C first; Student_A ranks it second). I will apply now and emphasize fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_C. Please confirm your commitment, and we will finalize your enrollment. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority ranks Student_D 3rd (behind Student_C and Student_B). In this round I have applications from Student_D and Student_E; between them, Student_D is higher priority than Student_E, so accepting D would weakly improve over E. However, accepting now uses my only quota and may block a higher-priority student (Student_C or Student_B) from applying in later rounds. Student_C prefers School_D then School_A then School_B before School_C, so C may never reach me; Student_B ranks School_C last, so very unlikely to apply. Student_D ranks School_C first and is applying now, making this a strong, likely-stable match. Given the low probability of receiving Student_C or Student_B later, accepting Student_D maximizes expected outcome versus waiting and risking ending with Student_E or no match.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_E. School_C is my first choice and I’m very eager to join your community. I’m applying now and would be excited to commit if offered the seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (4th), while several other students rank School_C highly (Student_A #2, Student_D #1). If I wait, I may lose the only seat to a higher-priority applicant (Student_C or Student_B). Applying immediately maximizes my chance at my #1 outcome; if rejected, I can pivot next round to School_B or School_A.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission. We appreciate your consideration of School_C and wish you the best with your other applications. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and already matched with Student_D via ACCEPT, leaving remaining quota 0. Rules require rejecting any further APPLY when quota is 0. Although Student_E is on our true priority list (ranked below Student_D), we cannot accept without violating quota. Maintain commitment to matched student and reject politely.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Although School_B ranks me behind Student_D and Student_A, applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before capacity fills. I will make a clear [APPLY] and emphasize strong fit and commitment to attend if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for indicating School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities and the limited availability this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). In round 1, accepting Student_B immediately would fill our only seat and foreclose the chance to match with Student_D or Student_A, who are higher priority and may still apply later. Student_B lists School_B as first choice, so they are likely to apply strongly, but we can still reject now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates given the early stage of the market and no other applications in our inbox this round.

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be honored to enroll if offered a seat. I’m submitting my formal application and hope you will consider me seriously.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and only Student_D and Student_E outrank me. I should apply immediately to secure the best possible outcome before School_D fills.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_D as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We look forward to welcoming you to our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is on our true priority list (3rd). However, higher-priority students for School_D are Student_D (1st) and Student_E (2nd). Student_D ranks School_D last, so unlikely to apply; Student_E ranks School_D 4th, also unlikely early. Student_C ranks School_D 1st and has applied now, making this a strong, likely-secure match. With quota 1 and no other applicants in this round, accepting Student_C locks in a good outcome rather than risking an unfilled seat while waiting for higher-priority students who may never apply.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_B and I’m writing to formally apply to School_A. School_A is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your community. If admitted, I’m prepared to commit to enrolling.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me and, given their priority order, they will likely fill their single seat with Student_D or Student_A if either applies. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and I am School_A’s top priority, so applying there should secure an acceptance immediately and yields a strong outcome compared to risking delays. I will signal strong interest and commitment to improve acceptance likelihood (though priority already favors me).

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application to School_A. After reviewing your submission, we are pleased to offer you admission. We would be excited to welcome you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and is currently unmatched. Student_B is School_A’s top priority (#1) on the true priority list. Student_B has applied this round; accepting secures the best possible match for School_A. There is no higher-ranked candidate to wait for, and delaying risks losing Student_B to other schools (Student_B’s top choice is School_B). Therefore, accept immediately.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A. I’m reaching out to formally apply to School_B. I value the school’s academic expectations and community, and I believe I would contribute positively while taking full advantage of the program. If offered admission, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_C is my 2nd choice but it is already matched, and School_D (3rd) is also matched. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_B is my 4th choice and I have relatively strong priority there (2nd after Student_D). Since School_A already rejected me and is my top choice but likely to prioritize Student_B and Student_D ahead of me, the best way to secure the highest feasible outcome now is to apply to School_B with a clear commitment statement to improve acceptance chances this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application to School_B and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B.

Please confirm your acceptance through the matching process. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B’s true priority ranks Student_D #1, Student_A #2, Student_B #3, Student_C #4, Student_E #5. Current inbox has Student_A and Student_E applying; Student_A is higher priority than Student_E. Although holding the seat could, in theory, allow a later match with Student_D, Student_D’s preferences place School_B as their 3rd choice behind School_C and School_A, and they are highly prioritized by School_D and School_A as well, making it unlikely they will come to School_B. Given we have an immediate application from our #2 candidate and only one seat, accepting Student_A maximizes expected outcome versus waiting and risking ending with only lower-priority options or no match.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_E. School_B is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the chance to join your community. I’m applying for your open seat and would be ready to commit if offered admission. Thank you very much for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_C has already rejected me due to capacity being filled, so I should move to my next best remaining option. Among unmatched schools (A, B, E), School_B is my #2 true choice. Although School_B’s priority ranks me last, applying now is still optimal because (1) I prefer B over A and E, and (2) the seat is currently unfilled, so there is at least a chance if higher-priority students focus elsewhere or are already matched. I will submit a clear, commitment-forward application to maximize acceptance chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re not able to offer you admission.

We appreciate you reaching out and wish you the very best in the remainder of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Quota is already filled (0) with Student_A, who is high on School_B’s true priority list (2nd). Rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Student_E is also lowest on our priority list, and even if capacity existed we would not displace Student_A. Therefore must reject Student_E’s application this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Team—I'm Student_E. I understand you still have an open seat, and I would like to formally apply. If offered admission, I’m ready to accept and commit immediately. Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Since I have already been rejected by School_C and School_B due to filled seats, I should secure a match by applying to School_E now and clearly indicating I will commit if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and your clear commitment. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

Welcome—please confirm your enrollment steps as instructed by the admissions office.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We have 1 seat and no current match. Given other students’ preferences, Student_A/C/B rank School_E last and are unlikely to apply early; Student_D ranks School_E 4th but School_E ranks D last. Waiting could risk ending unmatched, while accepting E secures a preferred (listed) student. Since we prefer any listed student over leaving empty, and Student_E is listed, accept now.
